noun.description: Any of several Niger–Congo languages which belong to the Ubangi branch of Adamawa-Ubangi and are spoken by two peoples inhabiting parts of the Central African Republic and adjacent areas of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
A member of either of two peoples inhabiting parts of the Central African Republic and adjacent areas of the Democratic Republic of the Congo; a speaker of Ngbaka.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Ngbaka or their languages.

origin: 1930s; earliest use found in Africa. From Ngbaka Ngbaka, self-designation.
